intro: Pedicularis jugentassica, commonly known as the Tibetan monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with intricate patterns. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it derives some nutrients from its host plants. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
